reviews_data.review_text: Let me just start by saying the food? WAS AMAZING. Being an CLT Offline Member, I'm prepared to try all the things from the recommendations I get matched with each month! Of course we ordered the Chicken Biscuit and also got a side of the cheesy grits which were PHENOMENAL. Coffees were also great during the cold rainy day we were having. Also got some little treats that were displayed at the front register area. What I wasn't a fan of was the service. No one greeted us when we walked in (except the fellas in the back by the beer) and upon reviewing the menu, my partner and I felt rushed and as if we were an inconvenience.  No one came to see if we needed anything our entire meal and no one attempted to tell us to have at the least a "day" when we left. Overall....would I visit again? For the food - Yes!! but if I have the same rude vibes, it will more than likely be the last time.
Good spot to drink but food has gone way downhill while going way up in price. Will purposefully eat before going here so I don't have to spend 20-25 bucks on average to below average food
Used to like this place, but they've changed. No longer a laid back place to chill.Just getting through the door is a hassle now.  Won't be going back.

Brunch was overpriced and pretty awful - $45 for a stale chicken biscuit and some greasy salty grits. Maybe it was a one-off bad experience, but I was not impressed at all with the food. Beer was fine.

Nice place and accommodating waitress. However, $51 for 2 burgers and 1 cocktail is absolutely ridiculous.  The burgers were ordered medium but, came overcooked and tough. Could tell they were either smashed into a ring or frozen. It's not that hard to hand pat burgers. The bloody mary was bland, but had plenty of vodka in it. For $12, it should. The fries were great though.
very good
Overall great place — but most recent visit,  service from waitress was poor and the dirty martini was absolutely foul🥴

In town for Christmas,went there with family,very disappointed with food,ordered a pizza,nachos,fries,and cauliflower for the table,fries were good,rest was below average,exp for price,main courses were also fair at best.for the price,expected a much better lunch
Great atmosphere

Service on a Saturday night at 7pm was fast, efficient, and polite. The bartender bought my friend's first drink because we were there celebrating her birthday. Great bar food that comes out fast and accurate. I haven't been in a long time, but I will definitely be back more frequently after tonight.
Fiancé enjoyed his beer. They did not know how to make a cocktail though. It was not drinkable. Had to sit outside if you didn't order food.

Price increase here has been pretty bad lately. It used to be reasonable and now it's just outrageous. Stuff that originally was 9 bucks is now 15.  Don't get me wrong I get inflation, but Suffolk is milking this to the T. Spot is very good for Thursdays, and has a really cool vibe to it. That still is going for it.
Awesome vibes and tasty coffee! Good spot to watch sporting events (World Cup games or football) and a space I'll definitely come back to outside with my pup!
Sweet vibes, beer is solid, try a Tree Top or a Daydream, food great.  Brussel Sprouts best in town...local spot, good for sports
Great service, great people and great atmosphere.

We had a party of 6 at 8:00 pm on Friday, 11/4/22. It was packed, but we were able to find a table outside! Suffolk is huge and so pretty. Great venue. Love the string lights. There was a band playing as party of Suffolk Punch's Daydream Music Fest.  We ordered through a QR code on our table. Service was so quick!!  Here's what I tried: - Grains and Things ($16): Large portion. Loved the ingredients. But the chicken was a little difficult to cut and there was too much goat cheese for my taste. Still good though! - Fungus Among Us ($16): OMG. So much flavor. So delicious. - Crispy Brussels ($6): Good! - Mac-N-Cheese ($6): Yummmm, currently craving this.  Suffolk Punch was awesome! Good for groups, date night, anything! Highly recommend!
BEST TRUFFLE FRIES ON THIS PLANET
order on phone, fast service for both the bar and kitchen! pet friendly too.

I travel and try to always stop at a local brewery. The staff here was rude, if they even had time to  acknowledge I was at the bar. Beer was warm and when I tried to ask questions of the bartender he was incredibly condescending . There are better options in this area .
Warm beer and lack of polite service will keep us from coming back.
Absolutely loved this place!  Gathered friends for  brunch on an early October day and the weather was amazing paired with the food and drinks.  Definitely will be back here, highly recommend.

Beers are pretty good but that fish and chips is the best fried fish I've ever had in my life.  Not sure if they marinated the fish or if it was something in the batter but it blew me away.  Anybody can make “good” fried fish, but this was on another level.

Great food, great atmosphere, great staff. I had the Asiago truffle fries, chips& spinach/artichoke dip, SP lemonade and the grains & things salad. The salad was healthy and uniquely delicious. I can't wait to come back and order it again
Such an amazing brewery, cannot express how amazing the staff, food, and drink is! I Will always stop in whenever I'm in Charlotte
Best Bar tender everrrr!

Wow, what good food. This place is a really cool place to eat with amazing food. I would love to come back again and check this place out again. The atmosphere was amazing with very good staff that did an amazing job, even during the busy Brunch time
My breakfast bowl was delicious! I also had the Beach Boii cocktail. It was amazing!
Nice vibe! Fish n chips were tasty! Good service!

If your looking for a great atmosphere, food, and customer service. This is my second time in less then a week. My first time was for my Anniversary ,and my second time was a Mother and Daughter date. I was so excited to have Cayley as our waitress for the second time. She is very sweet, has a great sense of humor, and had great food recommendations for us. I highly recommend Suffolk Punch and don't forget to ask for Cayle!
Had the SPB burger.  It was fantastic. I was impressed by the server as she took orders for 5 of us without writing down the order!  The fries were great as well.
This was my first visit. Half price bottles of wine on Tuesday's. Star was the best, loved her style and recommendations

Great place to have a beer (or 4) The service was awesome and the food flavorful. The only downside for me was the booth seating. I'm 6'5" and my wife is 6' and this was the only seating available for us.
Brunch 💅

Really good food and a great place in general. We had to sit outside despite the rain, but the service outside was quicker than most restaurants I've ever been to. You get to order through an app and keep your tab open. Beers come out within a minute or too which is really impressive considering how busy it is. The food is a little pricy, but it's really good. We had the spinach artichoke dip which I really recommend, the thai chili flat bread, and the burger. Pay attention to the menu because the carmalized onion jam has strawberries. I also super appreciate the compostable cutlery. The beer was really good as well. The IPAs as well as the seltzers and the frozen slushie drinks. Not really a bad thing to say!

Great outdoor seating. Band playing on Friday night. Industrial style bar inside. Burgers salads small bites typical bar food. Very good. Great brussels sprouts. Had a miscommunication with the waitress. She didn't tell us there was an up charge for Brussel sprouts. Jordan, manager made it right, did all the right things will definitely be back and spread the word,
Phenomenal food and great business hours, even open early on weekdays for coffee, beer, or breakfast!
Great outside area just off the train tracks and walking path. Very good snacks here.

Beautiful spot. Always clean which is great. Ordered food to go and no one brought the food to me or let me know the food was ready. The food was super dry and tasted so bad. Would never eat here again.
We stopped in for lunch. Food was good but seems a little on the pricey side for me. $16 hamburger and fries is a bit much for what you get.

Popular brewery in the South End area. Large taproom/ outside patio. Beers are mostly solid craft brews, some very good, some not so. Varied inventive food menu, no basics. Service is friendly, but I found it challenged. At the bar either 5 or 6 people were tripping over each other or you would not see a bartender in sight. Some lacked a welcoming personality. Trevor was the bright spot of the bunch. When weather permits, the outside patio with dedicated bar works great. Very nice coffee bar is a plus. Parking can be a challenge on weekends. Take the light rail, station at the back door
The vibe is nice and food is amazing!! The thai pork is unbelievable. The shrimp taco's were not my favorite.

first time here, beautiful place, great beer selection, bar staff not that attentative. Sat with an empty beer for a good while with multiple people behind the bar not asking me for another beer. Would've loved another beer but I'm not fond of the idea of chasing staff down to get service. Sat for almost 30mins with no beer or check with 4 staff and what looked like a manager behind the bar. Speaks for itself
Great beer, great staff. We tried a bunch of new beers on the menu. They certainly did not disappoint. Would recommend anyone to try
Good snack and foods here.. nice outdoor with fan , very relaxing with my drink  Definitely recommend
Great Ambiance & beer. Terrible food though.
Great little place with good food and friendly staff. Definitely a place to come back to and the have Blanton's if your interested.
Nice brunch menu and atmosphere.
Great atmosphere, great food, and even better beer!

This place is pretty cool I like the vibe, beers were good but I have to say, probably the worst  burger I've ever had. I ordered the tsp burger and it sounded so bomb it even looked great....but it had zero flavor it was so bland. The fries were delicious though.
Great environment... Great selection of beers!

This was a cool bar. Nothing made it stand out honestly. Signature drinks were delicious but pretty pricey, but common in south end area. The beers were priced well. Outside seating was cool and live music was a vibe
This place has a great vibe, food is amazing and a tremendous choice of drinks.

Brewery, pub, restaurant, cafe anchoring south end's renaissance. Well designed place with loads of outdoor space. Beer is very good - it has to be in a solid beer town like Charlotte. Food is excellent too. Dogs welcome outside. Lots of local young professionals hang here, but it's an attraction for the area itself. Tip: If you sit outside and use the app to order, remember to order a little at a time because everything on each submission will come together.
Shovel flag; go get it!

Went with a small group and we each ordered from different bartenders (ordering at different times) and they were all either unknowledgeable, unfriendly, or just plain rude. They had no well bourbon so the guy tried to tell me that Jim Beam was a Tennessee whiskey. Everyone in our group agreed that the drinks were extremely weak.  I've had better experiences there for lunch, but last night really soured my opinion of this place.
A great place to have a drink and food for a birthday dinner. We went here with a reservation, got right in. The atmosphere is nice and there are plenty of options on the menu. Highly recommended!
Dope spot...lots of different margaritas
surprisingly at a place where you think beer might be your go to drink, this place serves amazing cocktails also… the outdoor seating was fun with beautiful lights and ambience

My husband and I came across Suffolk Punch Brewing on TikTok. The location was easy to find since we are familiar with the area and don't live to far from it. After looking the menu online I knew we had to check them out because I'm always down to have a mimosa. Lol.  We wasn't able to make it to brunch but the lunch was good. Suffolk Punch is a real vibe. The service was fast and reliable. Along with the food and drinks. I will be going back for brunch because the feedback I was getting was telling me everything I wanted to hear.

Met with a few friends for brunch on a Sunday after hearing rave reviews about Suffolk Punch. The environment of the back patio reminded me of a busy cafeteria- loud, hot mayhem. Service was not particularly memorable as you had to scan a QR code and order from your phone- someone would later drop off your order with minimal acknowledgement. I mention this because the brunch wasn't cheap and patrons are often times going to restaurants such as these in part for the experience. The food itself was decent, but nothing I'd return for. The drinks looked like something you might order at a beach bar- no care really taken in making them. Sadly, I don't know that'd return. At least not on a Sunday afternoon.

Absolutely loved our food. Jonika was an amazing waitress and made sure to check on us several times even being the only customers. The MARGHERITA  was phenomenal. Cut like butter and melted in your mouth like that too. Overall would rate the service and food 10/5 Stars!!! New local favorite!! Thanks so much for all you help..

We stopped here on our way to Roanoke VA from Atlanta and it was worth the time. Lots of seating both indoor and out with easy ordering on your phone. Saturday is brunch till 3 and we had the pretzel, burger, fries and Mac&cheese. Food was tasty and the variety of beer did not disappoint. Parking was a little tight but there's plenty of street side parking in the area.
Good food and good beers. Enjoyed the ambience.
I enjoyed visiting here. It had a really nice seating inside and outside for your needs. The server did a good job and the food and drinks were great. I will definitely visit again.

We had a decent experience despite a rude employee. (Seems rude to seat us and give the impression they'll be right back - only to notice them eating a meal at the bar - and way after that asking someone else to take over our table). The space is attractive. The barware/glassware is beautiful! The Pulp Prescription IPA delicious. Good veggie burger. And look, I do not like to say anything negative - ever, but it wasn't a busy time and we were thirsty, friendly vacationers ready to go the whole way and buy merch and shout praises and all that… but…
Our first time here and it did not disappoint. A very lively place and fantastic food. We ordered a Cappuccino, Huevos Rancheros, Chicken Biscuit
Damn good food and beer!

We came for the first time Sunday for brunch and absolutely enjoyed the ambience, food and experience. Our server was very knowledgeable, attentive, and he was absolutely FUNNY(hate I don't remember his name). We all shared the French toast that were muffin tops, chicken biscuit sandwich that is extremely HUGE and the devil eggs! Cocktails were amazing. We definitely will be back to grab some dinner and lunch soon!

When helped at the door, the cashier wasn't attentive and not helpful with the menu. After we ordered there wasn't good communication at all. We sat down but then were told to sit outside. We sit outside, and someone tells us, you have to get your drinks inside. We then went to get our drinks, and the bartenders ignored us immediately then got an attitude because we didn't hear them calling our name but again weren't told how it works at this restaurant. We went to pay and were ignored again but then asked how can I help you with a horrible tone of voice and tossed the receipt. I will never come here or recommend this place to anyone.
Had lunch there today- the tacos were unbelievable! Charming atmosphere- I highly recommend this place!

This place was incredible, the beer selections are great, absolutely fell for a good amount of them. My partner and I tried a few flights and honestly this brewery is one of my favorites now. The food is amazing and found the staff to be wonderful, they were super accommodating of any questions we had. Large space indoor and out. 10/10 coming back.

Food was amazing. Deon and the bartender w the tattoo sleeve are stellar. Thank goodness they stepped up after sitting with no service.  Service is dependent if you get a bartender actually willing to serve the minority demographic.

The staff is ultra friendly and knowledgeable. We didn't wait long for anything we ordered. The food was fantastic! All the beer was good I liked everything picked for the flights. I want to come back for brunch, and in warmer weather. It's a stunning location as well.
Huge, cool indoor/outdoor space. Brunch was great! Coffee drinks and beer were both delicious and I'll probably have dreams about the chicken biscuit
Great food, great service it is really cold inside. Needs better heating system. Everyone in the restaurant had their jacket on and people were talking about it.
Great place to hangout with friends, even on a weekday evening. Food and beer is great! Buffalo Cauliflower dip was the best!!
Great place! Perfect for brunch.

This was our first time at this brewery. Parking was hard to find but it could be due to how popular this place is on Saturday's. We were seated immediately and ordered about 5 mins later. Our waitress was very attentive. The food came out within 5 mins with excellent portions sizes. Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a chill vibe, good food and excellent service. We will definitely be back!
Awesome little Brewery. Wide selection of beer and some good eats to go along with it.

Had a great time at Suffolk Punch in Charlotte. I went on a Thursday night and they had a selection of draft beers that were $3. We had brussel sprouts as an app. They came out on 30 seconds and were cold. They still were good. I had the BBQ chicken nachos. The bbq chicken was really good and the nachos had tons of cheese and toppings. Would definitely order that again. The service was really good too! Looking forward to going back!
Awesome vibe, great selection of beer and delicious food

I would not return based on the lack of cleanliness I observed on my recent visit. I was seated near the kitchen and had a perfect view of the area food is picked up from and delivered to tables. I observed a few of the women playing with/adjusting their hair and then grabbing plates to deliver it to tables. I observed one man that took his hat off adjusted it and put it back on right over the food holding area. These individuals did not wash or sanitize at all. The servers are responsible for adding fries that are held in a bowl to the plates. Because of their lack of cleanliness this was not well received. My food was just ok. My fries were overcooked and just warm. My burger appeared to have unknown particles, thinner than hair so I don't think that's what is was. My friend described her French toast muffin as very bad and something they should rework. It completely fell apart and was very soggy. Our server was nice but the hostess instructed us to wait at the to go ordering area. When someone came he told us to go to the hostess stand. She then said she thought we were ordering to go, not sure why she assumed that or at the least just asked. The best part was the cold brew cocktails, they were very good but would not make me return. Glad I went, now I know.
Visiting from abroad and found the link to the menu would not work unless you use their WiFi? Nice food, generous portions, so we shared.

Killer brunch!! I had the breakfast bowl and was very impressed. They had some great NA options/a very good mocktail for those who don't want to drink. The food came out quickly and it was super easy to order off of the QR code while sitting in the outdoor tent.
Unreal chicken biscuit

Came by for brunch with my husband and we loved it!! Such a great spot. The atmosphere was cozy and I loved the way it was designed & decorated inside. We both got a biscuit and a latte. I also got a side of potatoes which were insanely delicious. Everything tasted great and we will definitely go back! The staff was friendly too.

This place is a hit and miss and I simply say that because they are forever changing the menu which doesn't help aid to the food selection one bit. The atmosphere is always nice and that's why give it three stars.
Awesome atmosphere and dining experience.  The burger was delicious and on a special... the drink was refreshing and amazing.

Suffolk Punch [Southend] May you have the drive of a Suffolk Punch ! [Suffolk Punch—a hardworking, chestnut draught horse] Tip o' the hat to the Bartenders/ Waitstaff ! Friendly !! Cold beer,  many great choices  / Upscale food menu     $$ Dog Friendly large porch/ on Rail Line/Adult atmosphere Scrappy, the PirateDog

Such a beautiful establishment inside and out. After you've taken in the gorgeous architecture and decor, you are met with top notch customer service. The friendly and quick service go well with their massive serving sizes and delicious drinks. For what appeared to be a small wait staff I was super impressed with how tentative and professional they were. Will definitely be coming back to see what lunch and dinner and of course the extensive beer offerings.

So I returned here a few months back when some family came to visit and had a much better experience than I had had the first time I visited for brunch. This time I went for dinner and I had the Dilly-Dilly Sandwich which I must say is a pickle lovers delight!! The pickle brined chicken caught my eye and it was as good as it sounds! I chose hand cut fries to accompany my tasty sandwich. I also paired that with a margarita from their cocktail menu. I wish I could remember the name of it but it was delicious! Very pleased to have had a great experience the second time around and I look forward to trying them out again soon!
Great service and atmosphere. Loved the variety of beers and the delicious food. Looking forward to returning soon.

First time here but definitely not my last!! We stopped in for some drinks and appetizers! Ashley was our server and did an amazing job. She was very attentive and constantly checked on us. I had a couple beers, and a shot of Bourbon along with a pretzel. I really loved the vibe they had here, the music playlist was amazing. Restrooms were clean and all staff wore masks while I was there.  I highly recommend stopping by, they're right on the blue line which makes it convenient if you have a few too many......  Sadly I didn't take the time to get photos, so you'll just have to go for yourself 😁

Nice ambience,  friendly staffs. Food and beer are also priced reasonably but less in quantity,  bit on the finer side of dining.  Restrooms were extremely clean. Parking was a headache here as the designated parking spot is too small. We had to park at a distance with a constant concern of getting the car towed away. Luckily nothing of that sort happened.  Overall,  enjoyed the bar and definitely recommend it.

As a food and beverage manger in Columbus Ohio  with over 20 years of experience  this was Without a doubt the best restaurants I've ever been to The service was wonderful the food was absolutely excellent if we had a place like this in Columbus Ohio it would be one of the best restaurants in Columbus without it out great job It makes me want to move here and work here wonderful wonderful job The whole atmosphere was absolutely wonderful great job
Nice spot with open space to hangout.

Great little Diddy in the South End. Limited parking, so highly recommend the Blue Line light rail as there is a stop a couple hundred feet from this area that houses a couple different breweries. Was a bit disappointed in a couple of the seasonal drafts being out and it isn't even the middle of the month, yet. Still, there were some good selections of beer, cocktails and wine. The food is good and the queso served with blue chips has their own pineapple salsa on top that is very good. Definitely one place to visit again, but next time, take the Light Rail. Great outdoor seating area, too.
Why the bar tender chose to charge my card an extra 50 bucks in two additional charges is beyond me. Service was bad, prices inaccurate and you get your money stolen, amazing.

I didn't catch his name but the outdoor manager was wonderful. He helped us watch the game we wanted and was very kind to our dog. We've been here >15 times and will continue to return. Atmosphere is always wonderful. We even celebrated our engagement here with friends. Perfect spot for a few drinks and food is always solid
Really tasty beverages. Appetizers were great. Service was slow at first then improved.
What is with the bee DJ on Thursday's… this is not the Suffolk vibe. I can't even hear myself think it's so loud. I come to Suffolk to socialize not to hear thumping music.
No more DJs. Please.
I love Suffolk Thursdays (would give 5 stars) but for the love of god please stop with the DJs. Not the vibe. At all.
Great menu and friendly staff.  Suffolk Punch is to me the very best stop on the rail trail.  The food, drink and atomsphere are amazing!  I've never been disappointed!

Always delicious! From brunch to dinner. Suffolk just does it right. The coffee bar inside serves delicious lattes. The atmosphere of the whole campus is amazing. Multiple bars to order drinks and live music on the weekends. Do not miss this place.

Yesterdays' experience was one to remember say the least...Let's talk about parking....A Mess !!! We went for Sunday brunch , arriving at 11am. Parking is craaazy, arrive at 10am if you can. The venue is beautiful on the inside, and it smells amazing. We didn't wait long, 20 minutes. Our table was dirty when they sat us down , which is a bummer for me because I'm big on cleaning. The man was kind about it and quickly wiped it down ( with a dingy wash rag looking thing ). Our waitress was very short with us, un-atentive and seemed bothered by something. We had to ask several times for basic things such as napkins and forks , extra plates.  Chicken buiscut was dry,  the buiscut itself was delicious,  the gravy was delicious but the chicken was so dry. The potatoes were seasoned well, nice crisp 👌.  The French toast was soooo good 👍 😋!!!! The mimosa was very much just orange juice 👎 👎 👎. Menu was veeeeery limited for they were shortstaffed in the kitchen. As was explained to us.  I'll return in a few weeks give them another try,  as long as I font get that waitress

I loved this place so much! I get why it's so trendy and popular. Tons of seating options, indoor and outdoor. They have such an amazing selection of drinks, from beers and cocktails to coffees as well. I only came for cocktails, but I'd love to return for coffee or brunch. The atmosphere was so lively, and every employee I interacted with was friendly and nice. I didn't get everyone's names, but I remember a girl named Tashi, she was awesome!  A++++

Very nice atmosphere. It was buzzing with energy and a lot of noise (if you don't want to be in a noisy, busy restaurant, then I would pick a different one depending on the occasion). Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. We enjoyed a number of drinks and they were all delicious. My eyes were bigger than my stomach. Each portion is a LOT so be aware of that when ordering for the table. I ate so many apps that I could barely eat my pizza. The chicken wings were fried perfectly and seasoned/sauced just right. You couldn't eat them without making a mess and we were completely fine making that mess. The cauliflower app was also very tasty. My pizza was topped with too many things so the middle was soggy and liquid-y. That would have been the only feedback from our evening there. We would definitely go back to eat and try other cocktails.
It had a nice ambiance and the food was alright. My friend was buying, so I ended up only buying one drink but was charged $17 even though I was told $8 at checkout.
Must have a Hyde in the Haze

The Veggie burger was absolutely incredible. There was soooo much flavor, at the end of the bite you'll taste a hint of spice. You won't be disappointed, and oh yeah the goat cheese is an excellent compliment.
A smart blend of quality food, on-trend brews, and relaxing atmosphere, with amazing light rail convenience.

Update: service also gets 5 stars. Came back with a friend who was visitng from out of town. Wonderful experience from the top down. Food was just as good as ever and service was top notch. Cayley was fantastic: efficient, friendly, and provided us with quality suggestions (folks, get the grits, you won't be sorry)! Get here early, they fill up quick!  Previous: Food quality, 5 stars. Ambiance, 5 stars. Brunch portions, 5 stars. Service gets 3 for now. It took almost 20 min just to get an acknowledgement from our server. The hostess came over and helped us flag down our server and gave us some water while we waited. From then on, it was great, food came out lightning fast and piping hot once we got our order in.  Definitely going back, but hopeful for a little better service next time around.

Expansive brewery, beer hall look inside but with plants, cozy, quite large area outside, about half of it picnic tables in gravel.  Another area cover.  Good amount of beers available and they have decent wine. The food is nice too, the ham pinino  and the veggie burger were tasty.  You can be sat inside, quite cool, or sit outside on your own.  If you go outside you have to order at the counter on the side.  You wait for the drinks near by but the bring the food out for you.  Overall quite pleasant.
The atmosphere is great, they have a nice outdoor beer garden and a large selection of beer and liquor. Their TSP burger is outstanding!
Amazing food! We ate brunch outside and they had a little band playing. Great vibe, cool set up.
Cool place.  Really didn't try any of the food but will try again another time.  Parking in the area is horrible.
Nice outdoor area to listen to live music.
Awesome food!!

By far my favorite place to hang out and have good food, good drinks and a good time. There's always a crowd and music. Their drinks are great, the food comes quick and as long as you time it right; there's not a bad spot in the house! It's right behind my place so it couldn't be easier to stop in for some fries😍
Fantastic food. Great experience.

Food was good the beer was good. The server probably shouldn't be in this business. At the end of our meal I handed the girl my card I told her I was not adding Gratuity onto my card I was going to tip in cash she acknowledged it and said ok... She really tried to pull one over on me it was simply deceitful and manager seemed to back her on it. Just said "sorry". Lol... Felt like it had been planned will never go back!  All I've got to say is check your receipt good before you leave!!!
Nice vibes. Great food
Ambience is great. It is a very good place to hangout with friends and family. We ordered drinks and they turned out good.
Family and dog friendly. Delicious beer and food. A giant patio and excellent service. What else can you ask for?
Brussel sprouts weren't my fav but the Mac and cheese was to die for!! And loved the hard kombucha on tap!!
Beer, cocktails and food...awesome! Atmosphere...amazing! Service...phenomenal! Out bartender, Kevin, is the man!  Will be back for more!

One of the cooler breweries in South end as it had a great location for people, a coffee shop, a great food menu, liqour, and lots of space. Hazy IPAs I tried were very good. The food sounded better than it tasted, it was good but could have been alot better. Blackened shrimp po boy tacos were not blacked and typically gulf shrimp are plumper. Tuna nachos were good when you get a full bite but they were kind of scattered with tuna and sauce. Yaki niku cauliflower also sounded awesome but was soso. I tried a slice of Buffalo chicken Flatbread and it was a bit too rich and the crust wasn't that good. I still plan to try thier dinner menu.
Amazing vibe & Great food!!!

Visited here with out of state friends May 15th.  Really cool place, love the mix of cocktails, beers and awesome food.  We enjoyed the outdoor sitting area, and bar.  There is covered and uncovered out door areas.  The staff was great and attentive.  Will def return to try many choices on their menu.
Very cool chill place. Loved the ambiance, very helpful servers with good recommendations. Big open outdoor seating and indoor seating as well. Would come back.
Decent food, good beer, good service, good crowd!

It was a great place to hang out!! Very low key bring your pet type of place. Food was delicious, I had the breakfast bowl and my friend had the roasted veggie bowl. The outside tables could use some umbrellas for shade if wanted by guests. It got bloody hot 🔥.

Only went as night cap, nice venue centrally located in South End. Open concept with several picnic table style seats, live band, and bar outside. There is an indoor as well but we didn't go in. The have full bar for liquor, ciders, beers, etc and nice ambiance with string lights for night. Next door connected venue for weddings. It was closed for a private event when we were outside too. Nice chill spot.

The beer isn't great. The patio is nice. That's about the three stars you're getting. They used to host Robot Johnson comedy shows in an event space they unfortunately got rid of. Their lack of prep and staffing those nights gave me a good picture of the place. Was there tonight and although bars are allowed to stay open til 2 again, they chose to close at midnight. Alcohol can still be legally sold until 2 am. And legally sold alcohol in NC can be consumed until thirty minutes after close. They had muscleheads walking around kicking people out right at midnight who had full beverages. I informed them of the laws and they had some BS retort about private property as if liquor laws don't apply to every place that serves liquor. One guy claimed the restaurant angle and I've worked in a dozen restaurants in my time. It's not true. He was BSIng customers. I just... don't like this place. It's everything wrong with Charlotte.
French toast was phenomenal, but the cauliflower was absolutely terrible. Good atmosphere, but way overpriced for what you get.
No Handicap Parking to be found way overpriced Brunch pass unless you're walking and don't mind  waiting. Outside Band was way too loud.
Dj was great!!
Our favorite neighborhood spot - great beer deals on Thursdays & Sundays and the food has always been awesome. Also a great spot to take parents/family for brunch when they visit!

I live basically nextdoor to Suffolk so I spend much of my time there. I walk over for coffee (which is my favorite thing there--every drink is amazing) or I come in the evenings for a drink, fries or sometimes Sunday Brunch. The service is always fast, the people are always super sweet and the servers are personable and funny! ........and i've become slightly addicted to the TSP breakfast bowl--I've had it 50 times. But for real, definitely try it out. There craft drinks and coffee drinks are so yummy and its such a nice spot to chill out side during the summer! LOVE it here!
Lots of beer choices. I will say I had the most unique and incredible flavor of fish and chips in my life! I will make an effort to come back and have that again. Thanks!
Safe practices and decent food
Nice atmosphere with a wide selection of drinks.
Beer and cocktail selection was pretty good. Food was average. Service was slow. Will not likely return.

Excellent service, great beer selection, solid cocktails but the kitchen is disappointing. They cannot temp a burger to medium.  Ordered a breakfast burger for brunch, cooked medium but no alterations. The first time, they forgot the fried egg and served it well done. The server came back with the egg on a plate, saw how overdone the burger was and offered a refire. The second time, all the ingredients were there but the burger was well done, again. Gave up on it after the second time but not what you expect from such a well rated restaurant.  I'd go back and try other foods, but if you like your burger under well, I'd pass.
Pricey place. With good drinks and good food

Had brunch and it was hard to decide what to get because it all looked so good. I had the vegetable hash which was amazing, my wife had the breakfast burger which she loved eventhough it had an egg on it which I am staunchly against putting egg on a burger. The beer is amazing,  they have a type for everyone.
Great place for brunch, have a cocktail and bar menu.  Had the breakfast bowl and it was amazing.  Very friendly staff and great place if you're looking for something new

The food was great. The portions were big and the price was fair. However, the service needs improvement. The structure of the restaurant is very confusing. There's 3 dining options that were not explained well. Upon sitting on a table my girlfriend and I were asked to sit outside as that space was dedicated to “dine-in” customers. I wish there was someone explaining how the restaurant works or at least better signage indicating how the service works. The staff could be more friendly too. Overall I'd return because of the food and ambiance. Also, we had ordered coffee with our food and never received our beverages. We had to go ask and then we were told we had to pick up with the barista. The communication between staff and customer was very poor and needs improvement.
Always great service and food.

Definitely a great place to try out. Have been there multiple times and the beer is great. I especially like the 16 hands and the Pulp Fiction. Two excellent IPA's. The wait staff is always super friendly and the food is good. I usually get the bean burger which is very good and the fries which are more shoestring style which are not my favorite. Will definitely be back.

General experience of place, drink and food was good! They made our sandwiches so fast and they were all delicious. But, they had a problem with my credit card and they asked me to call them the day after my visit! I called them twice and they were supposed to call me back and it's for a month ago! Long story short they charged me with 20% tip which is fair, but I do believe I need to sign and gave them tip not they by themselves! Any way it was my last visit!
Not great experience during COVID - alway have loved this place until recent.
Great place to bring the squad.  Lots of room. Come for the industrial vibes, stay for the giant pretzel dipping sauce.

Waitress Callie is fantastic! All waitstaff and hosts are kind and accurate. DELICIOUS food and drinks 🤩 also taking clear social distance and safety measures 👍 thank you.  Only complaint is that one of the line cooks (locs and earrings) wore his mask below his nose and mouth the whole time... basically not even wearing a mask while making food.
Chicken Biscuit... That's all I've got to say
Excellent recommendations by staff.  Great experience.  Highly recommended
Great food great beer great service what more could you ask for

My family was visiting and brought them here for brunch. Food was fantastic as always, but wanted to give a shout out to all the guys running food. We had a small error in our order and they went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. It wasn't necessary but much appreciated.
Good food, good beer, good times!
Good food, Nice atmosphere, friendly service!

A great atmosphere and location. The food was better than I expected... and the drink menu was great!  The kid's food options weren't that exciting, so maybe not the best option if you have kids with limited palettes. (My niece loves only plain pizza and chicken tenders unfortunately.) The kid's cheese pizza is just bread with cheese on it... no sauce. Meh  Overall, I liked the spot and would go back!
Deon went above and beyond as a bartender to take care of me as a customer. He knows what he's making and the drinks are 💯. I highly recommend him and the people at The Suffolk Punch!
First time here. Unfortunately not too impressed. My husbands burger was over cooked. The kids burgers were the size of sliders on regular size buns, also over cooked :-(

I will likely never return.  Sunday brunch with half capacity. Food was 45 minute wait, food came out wrong 3 times between 2 people. Eggs and sausage were under cooked and they closed the kitchen down 2 times to catch up on orders.  My wife became ill ( dry heaved) from unrelated drinking issue- we all had 1 drink.  we were with our parents that are 50+( we weren't drinking to get drunk).  She went to the bathroom with no issue and a bouncer comes over and threatens to kick us out. I explained it was not her being a drunken mess, but a stomach issue and that we would take care of it. He threatened us again and I explained to him again my wife was not feeling well and we would take care of it.  It's unfortunate that we had such a bad experience because most of the staff seemed friendly enough, but I have no interest in returning.
Great beer, food and outdoor space. Multiple tvs for football as well

Jump through hurdles to give them your money. Sat outside so no menus available to order food. Haggled with inside to get menus (without cutlery, that's not allowed!) Then food allergies that can't be accommodated. Finally moved inside but have to sit in the far back. Still no food. 5 of us wanted lunch, dinner, and drinks! Was told the best way to reach the manager was to write a review and they'll reach out. Seems silly but let's see.
Great beer, good service. The wings are amazing, definitely will be back.  Oh and they were very aware and responsive of the protocol for Covid. Thanks

We went this morning for brunch. Deviled eggs and street corn and avocado toast were AMAZING and came quickly. My huevos rancheros took a bit longer and came out cold. Also, they piled everything together as the tortillas we're in the middle so they got soggy. Completely unusable as a tortilla. Maybe compartmentalize the dish as all parts we're delicious, but just got so soggy together. The booze was great so that made up for the wait.

Place was really beautiful and the staff was really friendly. Their chai latte was also very good, as well as their meal "The Twist", however I do feel like they are slightly overpriced (the meal moreso than the drink). The restaurant was generally clean as well.

Amazing brunch spot. They have tons of seating, with a small interior of their main building, a big outdoor seating section, and a second building with even more indoor seating. Do yourself a favor and get a mimosa pitcher and the Brunch Burger next Sunday. Dog friendly too!

Not many people know but a Suffolk Punch is a type of workhorse. Really cool name. Great brewery that serves overpriced food. They've done some great work lately to expand their outdoor area all the way to outside their adjacent event space, Norfolk Hall.

My first time here, first time in NC not to mention. I ordered a Hide the Rum, a cocktail which was $11. I received my drink which clearly wasn't poured to the top, in fact, the 2 others I was with noticed it as well. My boyfriend very politely asked if the bartender could pour a little more since it was mostly ice. She blatantly said "NOPE" and walked away. What a disappointment. Teach your employees some respect and manners. 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻

I am sad to report the past two visits haven't been great.  The kitchen staff is not wearing masks- you can see when the door opens.  Wings were excellent but both of our burgers were way too salty.  We were disappointed that our server did not know anything about the wine on the menu and was not able to share what whiskey they had.   We loved this place and were willing to pay for the overpriced food but sorry to say we won't be back anytime soon.
Nice enrivonment, good craft beer. They're also doing great on social distancing the tables
Awesome!!!
I've been here a few times and it has always been a good time. Plus I think on Thursday and Sunday the beers in red are 3 dollars

Quite possibly the best burger I've had in this lifetime!  Full of flavor. so many flavors in one sandwhich, it was really good!  I had the pleasure of eating lunch in this awesome establishment.  Took home a 4 pack of 16 hands DIPA...I love it.  I will be back! Thank you, Suffolk Punch!

Extremely pleased with the service. I had a giftcard that I have brought in before and they couldn't process it due to their system merging or updating with a new software. Thus, they told me to come back in a week and two weeks later I came back to try again but it was still not working. They were very nice and told me to come in and honored my giftcard anyway.  Not only are the burgers extremely tasty, but the people there are so nice! I will keep coming back here frequently!
Great deals and distancing in Sundays and Thursdays! Great for a brewery and brunch!

My husband and I visited Suffolk Punch this evening just to get out the house and plus they had outdoor seating. They are a brewery but had plenty of cocktail options and the drinks we had were very good and refreshing. The food was good as well, I had the grilled steak sandwich and my husband had the Cubano sandwich. There was a good taste to it and I enjoyed it but I just wish it was a little bit bigger especially given the price. Other than that, pretty cool hang out spot in South End
Brunch at Suffolk Punch social distancing style.
Place people love who happen to have a PH of 14
Great place!
No margaritas when you really want one!   Fun place to go. Lots of outside space.
Terrible nachos and cauliflower appetizers
Amazing staff and service. Great food and drinks. Come here everytime I'm in Charlotte
Great, fresh beer. The food is also fantastic, especially the chicken biscuit for brunch. Good location, quiet, and fun to watch the tram go by. Highly recommend, I will definitely be going back!
Coffee, beer, burgers. What more can I ask for? :-)
Loved the experience here!

Wife and I came in to Charlotte for a date weekend came here for brunch too start are good weekend away.  The  Waiter we had was very nice and professional he helped  Us with our beer selection and everyone he recommended was to our liking. We got some of the appetizers and we just shared the shrimp and grits which were amazing I'm from South Carolina and I feel the greats are not that good in South Carolina lol

Went here for brunch today. Coffee is so fresh, rose hibiscus cider was so clean and the fried chicken biscuit with gravy was so indulgent in all the right ways. Great atmosphere with lively music that brings you back to life after the night before. Food is always great no matter the time of day and they even know how to throw a NYE party

Went here for a coffee date last week and had the best latte I've probably ever had! Staff was friendly, and even though we only got coffee and ended up not ordering food, we didn't feel rushed at our table and could enjoy ourselves. Will definitely be back for a real meal and drink!

Most of their beer is not good by Charlotte brewery standards.  They have a great location and a great pilsner.  Other than that, it is really only worth going here for $3.25 beers on Sunday and Thursday.  They really paired back the number of $3.25 beers a few months ago.

Great beer and food! We had an awesome time as 50-somethings sharing a meal with friends. The restaurant was full so we ate in the beer garden tent. The beer was tasty and the food yummy. Not too noisy or crowded. But be careful of the benches, they are a bit tippy and very heavy if they turn over! (Glad no one got seriously hurt.) We saw a random newly wed couple in their tux and gown, which was unexpected but lovely. Recommend this pub!

Very nice brewery inside and out. The design of the building, the layout of the seating, the bar, and decor are very well done. It feels like an elevated brewery experience.  One thing I was happy to see was a warmer space on their large patio. During my visit in the winter the patio was covered with a tent and comfortable with heaters.  The drink menu has a lot of options from their beer to other's beer. They also serve cocktails and kombucha.  Great job!
Nice place

The Bear Necessities Cocktail was a "Hit". The Chicken N Biscuit had potential but was served lukewarm. Bar service was acceptable, food delivery was a "Miss". I will give them another chance but at a much later date.
Beer!!!
The patio. The espresso martini. The baked pimento cheese. The decor. And pretty much everything about this place is amazing.
Nice spot with plenty of beers to try and socialize. I'm. Big fan of the outdoor enclosed tent with the heaters inside to keep it nice and warm.

This place has a great atmosphere and the offerings of both a coffee bar and beer are well done. Not to mention a really great menu. The problem is the staff. When doing an event that I thought partnered with this space we were treated with an attitude. I went in to order food and they were pretty rude when I asked to see a menu. When other customers asked what was going on outside the response was I have no idea. This isn't the type of communication I get when partnering with other breweries and restaurants. They also double booked the event I was participating in and a wedding at the same time. So my event got the short end of the stick instead of the wedding. Unfortunately I can't recommend this place based on my experience.
Food was decent but pricy. Beer was pricy. Absolutely no handicap parking and parking in general was hard to find.
I know this is a brewery, but I absolutely LOVE their cocktails. The rosemary mule is amazing.

Food was great. Service was embarrassing at the bar. When you see 5 + employees doing nothing but gossiping in a large circle as you wait for any assistance, it makes for an uncomfortable experience...

Found this place on a whim and it looked good so I tried it, and so glad I did! They have plenty of beer options for every taste, a smallish menu but everything is really well executed. Veggie burger was homemade and you could tell, super authentic. Delicious fries and marinated cucumbers + tomatoes as well. Fun vibe in the place, very industrial chic. The staff couldn't have been nicer. I'll definitely be back and recommend it to others!!

We love the atmosphere of this place and the food is decent but there are some things having to do with service/management that could be improved. First, more vegan/vegetarian options please, it's 2019!! Second, it's super odd that there is no table service outside. Clearly a lot of time and money was spent constructing the garden farm tables and it's a big attraction of coming here. The waiters also seemed confused about how to handle people ordering food outside. Third, we came for breakfast today and they only had one food option, a ham and cheese sandwich. If you're going to pay staff to be open it makes sense to have a more comprehensive food menu. Again we love the concept, but hope these things can be improved to better the overall customer experience.
Wide range of beers that overall were good but the best burger I have had in a long time can't wait to go back.
Truly wonderful food, and an excellent beer selection

This place was recommended to us by an uber driver on our way into Charlotte. It has its on stop, located off of the tramway and is easy to get to from the downtown area. Nice restored building, combination of brick, iron and wood. Modern and rustic touches, lots of seating indoors and out. The staff was great, let us try some beers before ordering. I enjoyed there Ipa's and also their pilsner. We had some buffalo shrimp that were really good and hit the spot. We were there early on a Friday and it was not to crowded. There is a ton of apartments and condos in the area, I am sure it is packed evenings and weekends. Their beer is made on site, you can walk back and check on the large fermenters and brewing equipment. I believe they did offer tours. We took the tram so I can't comment about the parking. I really didn't see much but I have a feeling most people take public transportation or scooters. Those scooters are everywhere. It is family and pet friendly but not a lot for the kids to do. Their was a few corn hole boards and some room to roam around outside. Look forward to visiting again during our next stay in Charlotte.
Nice patio, good selection of beer and drinks. Food and drinks are good, but a little overpriced. With that being said, it's definitely worth checking out.

I am giving it a one star due to an overcharge on my credit card. I called multiple times, and the GM was never around or "too busy" i waited for a call back, never got one. When there is $17.00 charge that you did not authorized i believe it should be treated as high importance, or at least have the courtesy to follow back. I will suggest you all keep your receipts when giving a tip, bartenders are shady!
Cool place, good beer.

Oh man what can I say about this place that hasn't already been said. First and foremost, the hanging ivy creates such a cozy and inviting atmosphere. The whiskey cold brew is the perfect 1-2 punch for breakfast. Steak and eggs brunch meal was a little pricey but well worth it. Service at the bar could've improved, it was difficult to get the attention of our bartender. Overall a great experience and will be back again.
Outstanding service, very delicious food, huuuuge selection of drinks!
This place is super cool. It's nice that we are able to bring our precious pup with us and enjoy a tasty beverage. We didn't get food from here but hopefully next time we will!
Impossibly slow service. Bartender stole our credit card. Never again. Unbelievable.
The suffolk punch burger was fantastic as well as their scotch ale. Atmosphere was quiet and welcoming. Great place.

Totally bummed about the experience we had, especially because we were so excited to try this place. We arrived and went to see the hostess. She asked if we were dinning in and I let her know we wanted to order some appetizers to eat and drinks. We were told the dining room is only for people who are ordering a meal and we can't sit in there but go outside and there's a bar. The bar outside has limited beers, so we came back inside with hopes to find a spot at the bar. It was busy, which isn't their fault, but that did cause us to leave since we couldn't get a drink. I'm not really sure why we weren't allowed to sit down, but i am pretty bummed.
This place sucks

Always an diverse and large selection of house beers (With respect to neglected styles like english bitters) with a great selection of guest taps from some of the best NC breweries. Good cocktails and food makes sure everyone is comfortable and the patio has a great energy. It's always a pleasure coming here.  Sometimes the staff is a bit ridgid on seating, but I get it comes from a good place.
Farro salad add spinach. Yummy and seasonal. Loved the roasted squash.
Could tell the food sat at the counter for a while. Service and willingness of servers was off. Maybe, it was just a bad day.
The service was sub par.

Excellent experience.  Friendly and professional staff.  Treated my 12 year old son and I very well.  Great ambience  and attention to detail.  Food and beer were excellent and prices were fair.  Loved it, and I will be back next time I am in Charlotte.
Awesome list of on-tap in-house beers inside, with fun food options. Relaxed atmosphere outside, with an outdoor beer counter. Right on the light rail line, limited parking.
The bartender, Sarah, was wonderful! Excellent service and good food!
Great food and beer. Dog friendly. Nice outside patio.
Great Brunch and service!
Stopped by for a quick drink and service was amazing. Definitely would recommend this place

Great spot for happy hour! I was there the first time for happy hour last week I had accidentally left my sunglasses there, came back today, they had them there, thanks to Easton and Apil who were working there today, plus when I swung by today I tried their Vanilla Latte and one of their cookies, quite delicious!
Hard pass Always love it but They refused to substitute chicken for pork.  The manager blamed it on the cook  Clearly a leadership issue.

We were told by the hostess that we could only sit inside if we were eating. There were 4 tables open and no wait. They told us we could sit at the bar but there was 3 of us and only 2 chairs open (the reason, so the servers would stay busy) 15 minutes later, the two hostess sat a group of guys at a table inside that were only drinking. You can imagine thats pretty frustrating.  Food is good, drinks are good. Service needs some tweaking.
Great beer, great cocktails, great food, awesome service (wine list is only ok with inflated prices, even by restaurant standards).
Great atmosphere, great beer and great food.

Just to be clear, the food and drinks from Suffolk Punch are great, their customer service and event planning is one of the worst experiences I've ever had.  This place has been my new favorite go to spot for weekend brunch and craft beer, I've been coming here for months and the only complaint I've encountered is wait times on getting a table. Problem solved after finding the right times to go. While having brunch one day, my wife and I were party planning my daughters 2nd birthday when we came up with a brilliant idea, have the party at Suffolk Punch! Great food, drinks and plenty of space for guests. We inquired about it with our server and the hostess came by with their event planners information. The server and hostess showed us a great spot on the outside patio where we could have the party which sounded great until it became such a hassle trying to get ahold of their event planner. We sent multiple emails and called multiple times but she was never around. We were given the run around every time we followed up on an email to check our spam folder. FINALLY got ahold of their event planner a week before our planned party and was told she is no longer in that role and was not aware the staff was still giving out her name and information. When I asked for whoever the new event planner was, I was told they have not fulfilled that role yet. I was told a manager would reach out to me to help reserve a table, that call never came through. Luckily we had a plan B because no one from Suffolk Punch ever got back to us.  Revised review on 3/17/2019...  Spoke with the owner, he explained the event planner issue with me and understood my frustration and concern. He made things right and offered extraordinary hospitality during my next visit. I was very pleased and looking forward to my next visit to Suffolk Punch.
A great selection of beer and liquors.  Great staff and probably the best burger in Charlotte.  Highly recommend.

Family friendly.  Dog friendly.  Adult friendly.  Good outside scene when nice out and good inside scene when rainy or cold.  Lots of choices on beer, but also some alternatives for non beer people.  Food was better than I expected.  My new favorite brewery....they got the concept down.

The patio area is open seating and warm. We were able to order food from the outside bar, too, and it came super quick. The brunch menu (maybe for the outside patio area) was limited but pretty good. The fried chicken part of my biscuit, egg, chicken, and gravy was the best part; the rest was decent. I tried my girlfriend's egg muffin sandwich and it was good, too. A lot of tvs and seems like a good place for drinks, too. I think this is a good spot for a bigger group, solid food, TVs, and drinks.
Grabbed some tea from the coffee bar. Quick, amicable service. Sat in the patio with live music and tons of other 20 something's. Good vibes.
Great beer and cocktails
One of my favorite breweries in Charlotte!! Everyone is so much fun and nice. Especially the curly-q mustache man.

Came here for brunch- we got lucky and were able to find a table quickly but it was very crowded. Tried to order some food and we were told that the kitchen was closed for 30 minutes so they could catch up. It ended up being more like an hour before we could order anything. The beer we had while we were waiting was good, but the food was mediocre and not worth the wait.

Visited The Suffolk Punch for brunch for the first time earlier today and overall, had a wonderful experience. The atmosphere grants 5+ stars. Love all the plants and beautiful booths/ tables etc. I ordered an Americano, which unfortunately was not the best-- seems simple to fix as it was sour so possibly the espresso machine just needs to be calibrated. Or it could be the type of coffee but I'm assuming they use Espresso blend. I would not order an espresso based beverage there again. My friend enjoyed the spiced latte and said that was very good. Our waiter was friendly and food came out in a reasonable time frame with a good presentation. I enjoyed the breakfast burrito-- salsa tasted very fresh and loved that it was the perfect size for a meal (no waste)! The tortilla itself could use a little work but everything else was very delicious. My friend had the veggie hash which was very beautiful and she said tasty. We went at 10:30 am and it was definitely more packed (including parking) by the time we left. So I recommend getting in early or be prepared to wait a bit.
Great brews. I'm no vegan but the veggie burger sounded so good i went for it. Best decision i made all day.
This is an awesome place. The service and beers are A1

Do not go for brunch. Went at 12:15 pm. Waited 40 minutes for a table but there were 4 open tables that were not being used. They didn't want to overwork the wait staff. We waited over an hour for our food after we ordered. The manager said they have been experiencing very long ticket times. Offered us 20% off the bill but they clearly need to work on their staffing and kitchen problem. They're operating like a new restaurant. Food was delicious but kind of cold. Menu is super small. Go for the drinks, not the food.

Was in Hyde/Suffolk Punch watching basketball after spending the day DT for NBA All-star weekend. Couple drinks, ordered wings, and wings were lost in mix. Felt like a forgotten customer and started projecting that on the whole staff. Walker stepped up with the communication and hospitality during a busy time. Went to the restroom, paper towels being replaced on a receptical that was recently replaced. Talking to that attendant and Walker restored my opinion yo the establishment as a well functioning machine that looked out for it's patrons and co workers alike.

We went for Valentines Day because The Charlotte Agenda had given it such rave reviews and it did not disappoint! We love the indoor / outdoor feel and the creative interior design gave it such a warmth and yet elegant feel( or maybe the 24 longstem roses at the hostess table made it feel that way LOL). The warm interior and wondeful menu made it a perfect place for a drink and an app. They have quite a selection of beers and wine, and a wonderful app of "Frenched Wings" that were so tasty, and perfect for (2) to share. The BBQ glaze and the Red Pickled Onion made it a culinary extravaganza. This is a lot to say about an app. The menu is all chef inspired and clean. This charming brewery is a must for both Beer and Food. Enjoy!

Fried chicken and biscuits is pretty good. Very crispy, great flavor, and a huge portion. Very chill hangout spot for brunch, and will get super crowded. The server was telling us they weren't going to be able to put any orders into the kitchen for another 20 to 30 minutes. It did discourage some of us from ordering. We ended up having to wait quite a while for the food. People fighting for tables and benches outside weren't too much fun as we had a large group and not everyone showed up together. Wait might be better during less busy hours.

I cannot express how delicious the food is here. The mussels are incredible. I almost drank from the bowl. The ribeye is delicious. Come here and eat, you won't be disappointed. Also get a maple old fashioned to wash down dinner.
Great atmosphere and well-trained staff. The in-house Brews were pretty good too
Great atmosphere, great food, service, and wonderful beer

Want a fun place off Griffin where you can get a good beer, specialty coffee, cocktail AND bring your dog? This is it.  Food is average but the servers are knowledgeable and on point.  Most beers have a high alcohol content but somehow most turn out well rounded.  Bravo to the brew master.  Wonder if they got there fermentation science degrees from APP State.

My first experience here, many months ago, was a bit rocky but my recent server Kris, changed everything.  She was absolutely awesome and super hospitable! She gave honest recommendations on the food - she was not joking about the pimiento cheese - it was bomb!  Super knowledgeable about the beers on tap, and can recommend something based off of what you typically drink. Can be a bit slow when it comes to receiving food and drink, but it's worth it when your server is outstandingly nice. She definitely went over the top to make our experience wonderful.  She has promotion written all over her.  Absolute professional and made my experience unforgettable.  Cannot wait to visit again and hopefully see her at a higher level within the Suffolk Punch group.

Good beers. Great service. Excellent food. 1st time there and visiting Charlotte. I will definitely be back. Large variety of many different kinds of beers. High quality food with good presentation as well as quantity.
Food was cold
Yummy creative brunch.  Beer selection is great.  Great place to go watch the game or just hangout with friends.
Food, service, beer top notch.
In town for a meeting. SPB is a great brewery with surprisingly great food! I had the cast iron ribeye with duck fat potatoes. It was great. Price was well worth it. Highly recommend!
Excellent coffee and breakfast selection in addition to the 16 delicious beers brewed in house!
Great setting. Impressive selection of beers, and food is welll done

Nice brewery with a bunch of drink options. They brew their own beer and have other local/non-local beer options too. They have different coffee drinks, espresso, tea selections, kombucha & specialty mixed drinks. They were out of vodka when we were there..? We went on Sunday for brunch @2pm and there wasn't a wait. They have a huge covered outdoor area you can sit at, but dogs are not allowed. They also have a uncovered outdoor area with picnic tables & cornhole that dogs are allowed at. The service was really great. We ordered the pimento cheese for an app, which was amazing! I ordered the french toast which was just average.
Really nice place to relax and grab a beer.
Our first visit to Suffolk Punch. We only had drinks this time but will return to try the food.  Great fun environment, really enjoyed it.
I was surprised at the high quality of beer here, only a young brewery but everything I tried was mature in flavour and super drinkable.
Excellent food
Good beer, small menu but great burgers, and don't sleep on their coffee!

Beer and food was good.  We had the pork belly app and the Reuben.  Nice atmosphere.  I liked "The Unruly Pig"   ESB.  The bar service was lacking.  Beer in a plastic cup when I could see pint glasses behind the bar.  The bartender didn't even wipe down the bar for us and my husband drenched his sleeve.
Great vibe and aesthetic. Great food. Good beer list and extensive brew list. HIGHLY recommend
Cool laid back place, big enough space for gathering, but parking is limited and the heat was not on.
Great atmosphere, food, and drinks.
Trendy spot, good craft beers, the menu looks chic but I didn't think the choices were that great

I love this place. Great location, accessible by train or bike. Moderate amount of car parking, great ambience both indoor or outdoor. I love that they have overflow outdoor bar on busy days or a food truck even flon really busy days for someone wanting a quick bite. Definitely check it out with a group of fun people!
Great beer, good food selection. A 2 for 1 location that has it all.
Large beer selection  and unique atmosphere makes this a great place to visit in Charlotte.

My husband and I consider this our favorite restaurant in Charlotte even after eating there 10+ times. The food and service and are always top notch. The drink selection also includes loads of local selections with seasonal rotations. And did I mention the atmosphere?!? Seriously drool worthy!
Great brunch, restaurant side of Hyde Brewery. Usually has live music on weekends and different events during the week. Really good craft beer.
Very good breakfast and brunch restaurant. French toast is good and fresh brewed in-house coffees. Service is also nice.
It's trying to be too many things at once and customer service suffers

Avoid Saturday brunch outside. First time here.  If you sit outside you order your food at the OUTSIDE bar. If you want a cocktail like a bloody Mary you have to order at the bar INSIDE. If you want coffee then you have to go from the cocktail bar around to the coffee bar.  Pancakes were supposed to come eith whipped butter but didnt. Went inside to ask for whipped butter and got a little tub of regular butter.  Ridiculous. Wont be back.  Update:  I exchanged emails with management and I believe they took the review to heart and will be making changes.  Based on their gracious response and the high recommendation from my daughter, who enjoys dinner at Suffolk Punch, I am upgrading my review to 4 stars.  Next time I'm in Charlotte I'll be coming back to check up on you!  :)
Great!!
Quick stop off the Light Rail... great beer selection
Great beer selection! The cocktails are pretty good too. The food, however, is inconsistent. I've had some really great items there but I've also had some things that are not so great...
Excellent beer, excellent food and excellent service!

I really enjoyed the meal. They had a lot of the little touches that are harder to fin in Charlotte. The pimento cheese with bacon jam was flavorful and served with crispy but chewy bread that was still warm. The beef is grass-fed. The waygu sandwich was really tasty. The jus was not overly salty. The beer was good and there was a wide variety of choices.

Just ate the most mind blowing "french dip" here! It's called the Shaved Wagyu sandwich! Shaved wagyu beef, horseradish cream, gruyere cheese, and onion strings on a weck roll with a side of au jus. Insane!! And their fries are some of the best in Charlotte. They come out soft, herby, salty, and just melt in your mouth!
Great atmosphere, it looks like a wonderful place to hang out and drink but our lunch left a lot to be desired.
Food is a little overpriced, but very good. Great beer with an awesome ambiance inside and out. Fun place to have some drinks
Great food, beer, and atmosphere!
The beers are good, the food is just ok. The service is great
Hyde brewery is the best. Good food good beer.
Service was horrible. Food was okay,  but over priced. Once was surely enough.
If man buns and oversized yoga pants are your thing, you'll love it. Service was nonexistent
93 health code inspection.........not good.
Pet-friendly, fun
A really nice brewery with terrific food. Great inside atmosphere, lots to choose from on tap, they even have some cocktails. Enjoyed the veggie burger and hand cut fries. Check them out!
Great food, coffee, brew & atmosphere!

Waited 15 min for two decaf Americano coffees from the 'coffee bar'. Our food came out faster than two coffees which meant my husband was waiting for the coffees while I ate my brunch and then he came back when I had finished (they don't bring it to your table if you are dining outside). That's a terrible customer experience that wasn't well thought out. If you want to eat separately from the rest of your party, come here...

Really great vibe. I ended up here twice in a week for totally different events. Once with a friend for tea and coffee, which was excellent. They ran out of the tea I selected but proactively brought me a delicious tea with an offer to replace it if it didn't like it. The barista's suggestion was spot on. Then I was there for a work event with a few dozen coworkers and the staff was incredibly prompt, attentive, and gracious as our team ate, drank, and closed the place down. I'll definitely be back to try lunch soon.
Craft beer heaven
24 Hyde brewed beers on tap!  Nice food selection to supplement.

Cool environment, solid beer selection. Best chicken wings ever. They serve only the flappers, but clip each end, remove one bone, and shove all the meat to one end. You can eat them in one, tender bite with no mess. Excellent BBQ sauce, very mild, so kids and wimpy wives can enjoy.
Great blt and fantastic side salad! Love the environmet!
Nice atmosphere!
Great new age Brewery with high quality food and great mixed drinks. Everybody is very friendly the place is very clean it is more on the pricey side but definitely worth it
Love the vibe and food. Always good food, beer and service.
Great lunch with friendly service.  The menu gave a variety of choices and they were all delicious. Our service was prompt and friendly.
The coffee and food was so good. Lovely atmosphere with hanging plants and nice lighting. We will be back!
Great brew and atmosphere

Very disappointed with the lack of service we just received. I came after a bridal shower with 10 other girls, expecting to have a nice afternoon of cocktails and snacks. Immediately, we felt like an inconvenience because of the size of our group, and were told we could only sit at a table if we ordered food, which was no problem, but seemed silly when the cocktails cost as much as the food. The restaurant area was not busy at all. After asking for a sample of wine and not preferring it, I asked for another sample, and my server was clearly annoyed. She seemed like she had no interest in serving us. At $13/drink with 11 people, that's almost $150 round. We would have had at least 3-4 rounds this afternoon. Unfortunate for the restaurant. We are now at another bar/restaurant that is happy to have us. We will spend our money here.
Great atmosphere and good beer. Worth the visit.
Great place to get a flight of beer !! Enjoyed the beer! It was amazing

A little pricey, but definitely worth a visit. They have a huge beer selection and offer all-natural farm-to-table burgers, which are delicious! They also serve exceptionally good coffee out of the same place, which is a perk for me. If you live in the area or just looking for a quick bite or brew, this is an excellent choice in Charlotte's SouthEnd.

Great place for a couple beers with a great selection on tap. Took friends from out of town and staff was very patient and helpful when it came to picking their beer. Ordered the pretzels and cheese, came quick and was amazing. Decor in the inside is great and lots of space outside if your in the mood for a beer outdoors. Overall great bar.
Very well done.
Loved it! Great brewery... great drinks, great food, awesome atmosphere! Highly recommend!
Fun place. Lots of shaded outdoor seating.
What a great experience! The service was excellent and the food was good. I went with a group of 9 and the service was quick, our waitress was helpful and nice! The atmosphere is fun!
Great evening!  Staff was very helpful and made our event a success.....
Great patio and a tasty unfiltered IPA. Thanks. Will be back soon...
Delicious food!!! Great environment!!
Beer is meh. Apps are meh. Ambiance is good.

Great selection of beer (although $16 for a flight I thought was a bit steep). The flight did have some really good beers. The food sounded great but again thought it was a bit pricey so didn't buy anything. The feel of the place is cool, very stylish and well decorated.  The coffee bar had some interesting and really good drinks which we enjoyed.
Food was average... overpriced
Great place
Great selection of beers.
Neat environment, fantastic shrimp and grits!

Really enjoyed the shaved wagyu sandwich. Perfectly cooked, rich and buttery. Really hit the spot. Beer was cold and the service (Julia) was great.  The wings have a delectable sauce and come frenched, which must be tedious for the kitchen staff, but so delicious and easy to eat.  Well done. Very good job.
Highest Quality beer in town! Excellent variety, relaxing environment, and a great place to meet the boys after work.
Good Food
Cool setting and friendly people. Exactly what I thought it would be.
The food has really improved over the past year. Very tasty. Good selection of beer.
I post pictures of my food
Great food and drinks, beautiful atmosphere
Really fun mix of drinks and eats!!

This was my second visit to Suffolk Punch. I went for a coffee.. I went at 3:30pm on a Saturday and asked if there was a place to sit and drink my coffee. The barista said to ask the hostess. The hostess said I could sit at bar which was not where I would normally sit for coffee and there were no seats available. By the way, the entire restaurant seating area was empty. She said we could go outside. We sat at tables on patio. The server said we could sit there 45 min until they started seating for dinner. 5 minutes later a server told me I needed to move and go to picnic area which was also packed. In short, get some tables for the coffee bar if  indeed, you are a coffee bar. I'm going by what your website says . It's a weird setup. The coffee was good but I wouldn't return for just coffee. And I've had lunch there too. Food was pretty good. Debatable whether I would return. I've never taken time to write a review but I left feeling unwelcome. If I were an owner I would want  honest feedback. Hope someone takes note.
Had the huevos racheros for brunch which were pretty good. They serve brunch til 3 which is nice if you decide to sleep in on the weekend.
Really enjoy lunch here.

Brunch was amazing here. We were seated immediately with a warm greeting. Everyone was in a great mood - perhaps it was the wonderful weather - but we had exceptional service  Some really cool things about this restaurant/brewery - they have great local beer prices for their Sunday brunch. We're talking $4 or less for a local beer, that's great in my opinion.  I ordered the chilaquiles- they were phenomenal. My friends ordered the French roast and the basic breakfast. No matter what the order - the food was cooked at a great temp, and it tasted fantastic. (Although I should point out that everyone agreed mine was the best, so order the chilaquiles if you can).  All in all - no complaints. The venue was clean - parking was easy to get. The neighborhood is walkable but a good way from downtown so would recommend driving. The bar is large so you could always get a seat there if there wasn't seating too!
One of the best spots in the city!
Great food and drinks
The brunch was delicious. I had chilaquiles and my friend got the fried chicken biscuit. The coffee drinks are a little pricey but very tasty.

Touted as a Culinary Café, Coffee Bar, Taphouse, and Fermentation Lab, the Suffolk punch was one my favorite spots to visit in Charlotte. They are a microbrewery offering incredible food. the shaved wagyu French dip sandwich was so good we ordered it twice. Wings were in some sort of spicy maple glaze.
