They also offer plenty of bar food such as pretzels with beer cheese. The space is absolutely massive and stunning. Pull up to a booth and hang out for a few hours. Daytime it looks like a workspace with plenty of people tapping away on their laptop. Nighttime is a lively restaurant. The outdoor portion looked like a blast, but was too cold when I went.
Food SUB PAR.  Waited too long, def over priced!  , beer good.  I guess don't go to a brewery for the food.
First time here and we loved it!
I found the food a little pricey but the beer has been on point.
Don't eat here. Eggs were too salty and the coffee is restaurant grade, not coffee bar quality. There's better places to eat nearby.
Good atmosphere
Very good food and unique experience

We happened upon this place because TripleC was closed on a Monday.  What a great place!  Excellent tap selection including a great selection from Hyde Brewery and a number of guest taps. The food all sounds great.  The Suffolk Punch burger was a true craft burger.  Best place on the Blue Line light rail.

Loved the atmosphere and our food was great.  Our server was interesting.  She never smiled (actually looked rather pained to be there) and half the time only answered our questions by shaking her head no. We all have off days and several of us have been servers in the past so we laughed about it but other than that a good experience.
Good food and a nice mix of both their own beers as well as others, mostly from North Carolina
Parking is an issue. Love the burger.

Great atmosphere in the main dining and outside areas. They have new warehouse space right next door that is super basic- no heat, a cooler with one keg, no music (??? so easy to do) but they do have some picnic tables and games (corn hole). I'm sure they'll be doing more to this space. We went to this warehouse space because we were a large party and wanted to sit and have drinks and maybe some snacks and there wasn't any spots big enough for us all. While there were open tables, because of the hour (about 4ish I think), they couldn't let us sit in them. It was super odd and while they were very nice about it and you could tell they struggled with the policy as well, they couldn't really fully explain why we couldn't sit there. I made a reservation on the spot and they sat us in about 30 minutes but we all thought it was so odd. Food was tasty but very expensive for the portion.

I went to Suffolk on a Saturday brunch and we sat outside in the patio since we had a dog with us. The patio is warmed up and covered and it is a very nice looking! What I didn't like at all was the poor organization of the outside patio: you have to wake up and order at the bar outside because there are no servers who takes orders! what?? and you can order only beer or cocktails outside, but if you want coffee you need to go order it INSIDE by yourself and bring it out by yourself also!! seriously??? If the idea is to be a very classy brewery (the inside is super elegant), why sticking with poor service and careless organization in order to save on personnel?? Those numbers to put on the table after ordering food gives a gas station feeling and not a sophisticated look! Very cheap choice! You can definitely do better or think about another efficient way for managing the outside patio area! I ordered (pecan french toast and fried eggs sandwitch) and the chai tea: both very good! Since the food is on point, and the place itself also, please raise the bar with service!
This place is great,  good cocktails, great atmosphere. Really friendly bartenders
Great beer, awesome coffee, and just plain nice to hang at. Definitely coming back.

The food was fresh and had a good variety of full plates and shareables. The beer menu is expansive and guaranteed to please all beer drinkers. I had the veggie burger and it was very filling with great flavor. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly.
Food not that great. Coffee, beer and atmosphere is great to chillout.
Great beer

Let's start with the positive- if you're going for beers/casual drinks, this place is excellent. It's busy even on weeknights (relatively speaking), so it's a solid atmosphere with a wide variety of drink options.  However, they also position themselves as a coffee shop. When it comes to the coffee, it's not good. I've ordered several different coffee options, including my go-to Americano, and I have yet to enjoy any of the beverages. I want to like this place so badly because it's so convenient for me to go in the mornings, but I can't get over how awful the coffee is.  As a coffee shop it's a 1 star option. As a happy hour/casual drink spot it's a 5 star option.  I can't speak to the lunch menu because I haven't eaten here, but kind of hard to justify a $19 chicken salad....

I heard really good things about this place after it opened, so I scheduled a happy hour here.  Walking in, I immediately loved the decor. All of the plants are my favorite part. It was nice out so we sat on the patio.  They have a really large drink selection from their own beers, to other craft beer, to ciders, to cocktails. I had a cocktail and some ciders and they were all really good.  I ordered some small plates: the Pimiento cheese, the beet stained deviled eggs, and the tuna crudo. I enjoyed all of them, but they were a little expensive for the portion sizes you got.  My experience was pretty good until it started to get dark and cold outside and we tried to go inside. They wouldn't let us sit inside unless we ordered an entree. Given that we had already eaten and were trying to enjoy the brewery, this was very frustrating. I get that it's also a restaurant, but the fact that there is no way to enjoy the brewery without being outside is ridiculous.  We convinced someone to order an entree and the service inside want very good. The burger want cooked as ordered and the service was slow. The food is also pretty expensive.  I've avoided going here for happy hours since then because I don't want to be forced to sit outside if I don't want to eat. I think this is a pretty big problem they need to solve if they don't want to be a restaurant exclusively.

Hyde Brewery and Suffolk Punch have it all. Great location at the New Bern light rail stop. The food alone is wonderful, but you combine the food and Dan Hyde's craft brews and you have a great experience waiting for you. The brewery has a great section that is always expanding and changing, and Dan takes his craft beers to  new tastes. The location has brunch, coffee, tea, inside and outside tables. It is kid and dog friendly . The staff are friendly and know their brews, menus , and coffees. Give it a try  and you will not be disappointed. They also serve other local brewery's beers.

Drinks are amazing.  I always appreciate their beer list.  Regular menu items are always tasty. But...man... you guys really miss the mark on your charcuterie board.  I've ordered it multiple times and not once has anything been consistent.  Last night was no exception.  It comes out with 3 pieces of toast, three slices of everything and a little tiny dollop of the only cheese provided: blue cheese.  When I questioned if any other cheese is served (since, in the past, it was) I was told "It's a meat board, not a cheese board."   Thanks for that rude explanation... It's also $14 and had $5 worth of stuff on it.  My recommendation:  provide consistent "meat boards" every day...And explain in your menu that "cheese" really means a few crumbles of blue cheese.
Ok
Awesome food and service. Especially the bartenders. Jordan was awesome.
Food is excellent. Atmosphere is excellent. Well worth the premium price for premium food and drink.

Food was cold and took an hour to come out. Sent the short ribs back for being cold and they didn't attempt to remake it. The just microwaved it and sent it back out. Terrible service and no attempt to make it right. Beer was solid though.
Whiskey business drink is wonderful. Friend green tomatoes were too hard for my liking
Great food, great beer selection including their in-house Hyde beer, and great atmosphere / ambiance.
Amazing French toast. Decent beers. Dog friendly porch next to the Rail Trail with large farm tables good for groups.
Good food.  Nice brewery setting.
Brunch was delish
Good food, great drinks, cool atmosphere.
Went for brunch on Sunday. A pitcher of mimosas for $18 isn't bad, especially since it contains a whole bottle of champagne!  The food was also great and a decent price.

Great ambiance but horrible service. I hosted a party there last night for a party of 20 people. Even though they knew it's a huge party but they still seated us very close to other tables and kept complaining that we are crowding other tables. Our server killed the night for us, through out he was super mad that people were moving around. The worst was that in the end two of my friends were overcharged for couple of drinks and my husband had to pickup the check that the server claimed was not paid because he struggled to keep the tab. Very disappointed with service.

Excellent breakfast on a Saturday morning. I had the chilaquiles and my girlfriend had the chicken and biscuit. Both were very delicious, and the service was very quick, as the breakfast crowd is relatively light.  They have a their full bar menu open in the mornings, and their coffee is quite good! I highly this place for breakfast (and for all times really)!!

Went in to get drinks and food, party of 6. One in our group brought in outside food because he's a particularly picky eater, and is a child with cystic fibrosis. Apparently the policy is no outside food no exceptions, and wouldn't make any exceptions for health conditions even though rest of us were going to order food and make them a lot of coin they chose to be rude about it and resulted in all of us leaving. There are plenty other friendly establishments to take our business, so we did.
This spot is probably one of my favorites! The food is delicious, the beer is great and the atmosphere is fun! - Get yourself there!!
Great beer.  Great coffee.  Great outdoor space.
Great atmosphere, it's nice having a brewery vibe with more of a pub experience.
Awesome
Cool ambience, friendly staff, great beer selection. Love that they allow dogs in the enclosed tented section!
A great place to gets beers and other drinks, including coffee.

We were there early so we did not try the food. However, we had the opportunity to try the Nitro coffee (not for me), and had in-house coffee made for us. The brewista did a nice job at designing the coffees and they were flavorful. However, they were just not warm enough. We had the opportunity to also try some beers. The beers were very smooth, light and tasteful. The four stars are for the beers. However, working in this industry before, I find it tacky and distasteful when the owners-managers stand around and talk about their employees in front of customers. I also find it disappointing when they don't care to engage more with the customers than they do with each other. The atmosphere is warm and inviting and very well designed. But I would focus more on customer service, especially when the brewmaster is out and about and that's a great opportunity to engage with the customers who are trying his craft. Without customers you don't have a business. I would suggest focusing more on customers than each other. I would also suggest giving descriptions on your beer menu. Therefore, not asking customers to rely on the service of your employees when they are not readily available.

There aren't enough words to articulate on how much I love this place. Greast food, vegan burger was so good I didn't even think twice I wasn't eating meat!🖤🖤. Winston Salem could learn a lot about how to have a brewery that has a coffee menu, wine, and cocktail menu.... instead of posting food trucks up in front of each brewery. #pureclass
Excellent beer selection
Great Food, Great Selection of Beer, Great Prices, visually pleasing rustic chic
Absolutely love this place for an afternoon tea on draft or a pint during the game. Awesome concept and atmosphere!
Great place with dog friendly tent in the back.
Amazing architecture, interior design...and excellent food and service. Great visit with friend Nancy Albert. Thanks Tiffany for taking good care of us.

Great atmosphere, good service, awesome beer selection. However, I ordered the fried green tomatoes which were well done and the burger which was also over-cooked and the English muffin it was served on was rock hard and charred. I didn't say anything or send it back. Everyone else was happy with their orders. I'd definitely go back and try some other dishes.
Really cool Southend bar
Great food and beer.

The interior design and atmosphere was awesome.  Very chic and cozy.  The omelet and fingerling potatoes were very tasty.  However... the server was not friendly nor very attentive (but the hostess was very nice); I ordered a cappuccino from their coffee bar and it was ok but was delivered without the essential saucer, spoon, and sugar packets (all I had was a knife and fork from my rolled napkin).  I know, it's such a minor complaint but it's a coffee bar whom I would expect to do coffee serving correctly; and lastly, the beer from the Hyde Brewing was flat.  :( Parking is tight in their side gravel lot on a Saturday.  Luckily we got there just in time and snagged the only available spot. Hoping these issues can get worked out because I think this place has great potential.

The great - Food - excellent, we had the brunch menu. The chicken and biscuit was perfectly portioned and flavor outstanding!  Space- very nice decor and good ambiance to the place. It's a huge space.  Hostess - friendly interacted with us, great attitude.  The opportunities- service, server was not friendly.  Rushed us the entire time and the place was not busy.  I asked if they had a flight of their beers.  “Not on weekends”. ???  Figure that one out.  The beer - I only ordered one.  Because apparently weekend flights are outlawed here.  I like to try in-house brews.  the pale ale brewed in house was flat.  No carbonation at all.  They had a huge selection of beers I would recommend going with a beer not brewed in house unless you can sample their In house beers and you like it.
Awesome brunch on Sundays
Excellent place to grab brunch and relax during the week or Early Sunday.
Chicken n Biscuit is on point.

The service was exceptional. The beer selection was typical for similar establishments like this, including a diverse craft selection. The food was really the best part of the experience. My party showed up and after a few minutes the manager came over to tell us the kitchen was down for about 30 min. While it was inconvenient, the service more than made up for it, as well as the honestly. You have to go!
Awesome food great atmosphere and wonderful service

I really wanted to try the burger that I've heard was so good. I just sat outside for 15 mins while two of the wait staff walked past me repeatedly and never came to give me a menu, take my order, or let me know if I needed to move to be served. I'm hangry and will be telling others of the horrible service I got here advising them to go elsewhere nearby. Thanks for nothing. Very disappointed.
Expensive food with limited choices but the food is good. Beer isnt as as good as other brewerys.
Some of the best beer, service, food, and times in Charlotte defenetly would recommend. (Try Hyde brewing absolutely delicious) something for everyone to enjoy
Nice place, plenty of choices on beer, not so much on the food menu.
Super chill atmosphere and delicious Imperial IPA.

Fantastic atmosphere and aesthetic, but there's still some kinks to iron out.  We ordered the chicken sandwich and veggie burger for lunch.  The veggie burger was a tad bland and couldn't hold up to each bite.  The chicken sandwich tasted great but was a tad dry.  We also ordered bloody Mary's and while we were ok with them being orange, they tasted oddly sweet and lacked the traditional spice and extras.  The beer list and service was great, as was the coffee.  Parents be warned, this place has no changing tables for the countless babies brought here and no alternative space in the bathrooms.
Excellent place. Must try

I really like the atmosphere of this place. Good selection of beers. I'm not one to complain about staff or service, but the bar and bartenders seem like a 3 ring circus-- no one seems to know what to do or how to do it. Unless you refer to your beer by its menu number, they have no idea what to pour. It took 3 people to pour a vodka soda. Much slower than what it should be. The no food thing between 3 and 5 is also strange. The food is good though and reasonably priced.  New place with lots of potential, but the staff need some better training. With a full kitchen in the back, even a snack menu between lunch and dinner would be nice.

Atmosphere and food were amazing. Service, however, was poor. We were here celebrating a friends birthday. It was a Tuesday and their hours are until 10 pm. My boyfriend and I went up to the bar at 945 to order one last drink and were told that they were no longer serving drinks, as the bartender poured a drink for our friend who arrived at the bar at the same time as us, but simply ordered first. He was very rude with his statement. We sat down back outside while our friends finished their drinks, only to be rudely ushered out at 950 by a staff member saying "Guys we've got to go we're closing" rather than politely asking us to finish our drinks and leave. Maybe this hipster restaurant should take a hint from the other successful bars and focus on customer service rather than over priced drinks. Change your hours to 950 if you want to be closed earlier than 10.
Great beer with a fun environment. Menu was limited but good.
Nice, new. Great selection of brews.

Great place. Definitely will be a staple in Charlotte for a long time. Went tonight and learned their grand opening will be Aug 26th, so there were a few kinks that need to be worked out. Glad to see a spot with such an elevated sense of design and culture open in South End.
Way dank
Cool and BIG brewery just off the light rail in South End Charlotte. Get off on the New Bern stop just steps from the train.

Went the first day they were open, we had an absolute blast! The place is so beautiful! I smiled as soon as I walked in the door! The planters in the middle of the tables outside are such a cool idea and the hanging plants inside give the place a real rustic feel. Mike, our bartender was fantastic and answered any questions we had and was very quick to serve us. 10/10 would recommend!
